title: SCOTUS pauses Purdue Pharma bankruptcy plan over liability shield for founders
description: The Supreme Court on Thursday temporarily blocked Purdue Pharma’s plan to emerge from bankruptcy that shielded the Sackler families from liability in the opioid epidemic

title: Nearly 50,000 Americans died by suicide in 2022, a record-high number: CDC
description: A record-high 49,449 Americans died by suicide in 2022, according to new provisional data released Thursday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Ohio's abortion-related ballot vote: Takeaways and political fallout
description: Republicans suffered their latest electoral setback on a vote related to abortion, this time over a referendum in Ohio on Tuesday

title: WATCH:  Taylor Swift fans cheer for over 7 minutes after 'Champagne Problems' performance
description: Swift was left speechless after the unprecedented show of appreciation from concertgoers.

title: Striking screenwriters will resume negotiations with studios on Friday
description: The guild that represents striking film and television screenwriters says negotiations with major studios and streaming services will resume Friday

title: White supremacist arrested for threatening Pittsburgh synagogue jury: Feds
description: A West Virginia man was arrested Thursday on charges he threatened the jury and witnesses involved in the trial of Pittsburgh synagogue shooter Robert Bowers.

title: Texas sheriff says 3 hog hunters from Florida died in an underground tank after their dog fell in
description: A Texas sheriff says three hog hunters visiting from Florida died while apparently trying to rescue their dog after it fell into a hole filled with sewer gas in the middle of a cornfield

title: Percentage of US adults with long COVID falls to 6%: CDC
description: A CDC report published Thursday found the percentage of adults reporting current long COVID fell from 7.5% in June 2022 to 6% in June 2023.

title: Iran moves toward freeing 5 American citizens who had been imprisoned, in rare deal
description: Iran moves to release Siamak Namazi, Emad Shargi and Morad Tahbaz as well two other U.S. citizens in exchange for eventual access to billions of dollars in blocked assets

title: 9 Michigan Republicans plead not guilty to acting as 'fake electors' in 2020
description: Nine Michigan Republicans who were allegedly part of a plan to have "fake electors" counted in the tabulation of the 2020 presidential vote have pleaded not guilty.

title: WATCH:  Virgin Galactic launches 1st mission carrying paying customers to space
description: Virgin Galactic launched its first mission carrying paying customers to space, weeks after the company's first flight in June.

title: Mississippi Supreme Court won't remove Favre from lawsuit over misspent welfare money
description: The Mississippi Supreme Court says it will not remove NFL Hall of Famer Brett Favre as a defendant in a civil lawsuit that seeks to recover millions of dollars of misspent welfare money

title: Man escapes police custody by scaling down hospital wall with towels
description: Yenchun Chen, 44, was supposedly taking a shower when he made his escape.

title: Trump, Nauta plead not guilty to new docs charges but De Oliveira still not arraigned
description: Former President Trump and aide Walt Nauta both pleaded not guilty to new charges in the classified documents probe, but staffer Carlos De Oliveira was not arraigned.

title: 5 killed when recreational vehicle blows tire, crashes head-on into tractor-trailer
description: Pennsylvania state police say five people died when a recreational vehicle blew a tire on an interstate highway, crossed the median and collided head-on with a tractor-trailer

title: Prisoner uses sheets to escape from 5th floor of NYC hospital and hail taxi; he's still at large
description: Police say a prisoner receiving medical treatment escaped from a New York City hospital by tying sheets together, rappelling from a fifth-floor window and hailing a taxi

title: LIRR employee had unauthorized dual employment, MTA says
description: "Theft of time under any circumstance will not be tolerated at the MTA,"  MTA Inspector General Daniel G. Cort said.

title: US expresses 'growing concern' for safety of Niger's president amid apparent coup
description: The United States expressed "growing concern" for the safety of Niger's democratically elected president who remains under house arrest amid an apparent coup there.

title: Kai Cenat speaks out for 1st time since mayhem in NYC
description: Kai Cenat said in his first public comments that he is "beyond disappointed" with the large group that flooded Union Square park Friday afternoon.

title: Russia says it intercepted Moscow-bound drones for a second straight day
description: Russian officials say air defense systems have shot down two drones heading toward Moscow for the second straight day

title: Poland plans to deploy 10,000 troops to its border with Belarus
description: Poland’s defense minister says the country intends to put 10,000 soldiers along its border with Belarus

title: Inflation ticked up in July, reversing some progress in fight to slow price hikes
description: The fresh data arrived roughly two weeks after the Federal Reserve raised its benchmark interest rate another quarter of a percentage point.

title: Big fashion is getting bigger. Parent of Coach will buy Versace owner Capri in $8.5 billion deal
description: Tapestry, parent company of luxury handbag and accessories retailer Coach, is buying the owner of fashion brands including Michael Kors, Versace and Jimmy Choo, Capri Holdings

title: Boat carrying Rohingya migrants capsizes in the Bay of Bengal, killing at least 17
description: A rescue official says a boat carrying minority Rohingya migrants from Myanmar has capsized in the Bay of Bengal, leaving at least 17 people dead and about 30 missing

title: WATCH:  Fish swim around house after Philippines flooding
description: House ends up filled with tiny fish after severe flooding hits parts of the Philippines.

title: Presidential candidate assassinated in Ecuador
description: Fernando Villavicencio, a presidential candidate in Ecuador, was assassinated at the end of a campaign rally in Quito on Wednesday.

title: Police seek suspect in 'unacceptable' fatal shooting of 10-year-old in Virginia
description: A 24-year-old woman is wanted in connection with the fatal shooting of a 10-year-old boy in Virginia, law enforcement said.

title: First on ABC: Footage shows raid of home searched in Tupac Shakur murder case
description: Police have released the body camera footage in the recent nighttime search of a Las Vegas-area home in connection with the Tupac Shakur murder investigation.

title: WATCH:  Helicopter pilot flies over Hawaii town devastated by fire
description: Richard Olsten, owner and operator of a helicopter tour company on Maui, surveyed the damage after a deadly wildfire tore through the heart of the Hawaiian island.

title: Anti-corruption presidential candidate slain at campaign event in Ecuador's capital
description: An Ecuadorian presidential candidate known for speaking up against corruption has been shot and killed at a political rally in the capital, an attack that comes amid a wave of startling violence in the South American country

title: Former NFL player sentenced to at least 3 years in prison for fatal DUI crash
description: Former Las Vegas Raiders wide receiver Henry Ruggs III was sentenced to three to 10 years in prison for a deadly crash in Las Vegas.

title: NYC mayor wants more aid to offset $12B in costs for housing migrants
description: "Our compassion may be limitless, but our resources are not."
